intro: Sida permollis, commonly known as the silky sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It features slender, branching stems covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically pale green to white in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a soft, hairy texture. Sida permollis is adapted to a variety of soil types and is commonly found in disturbed areas and along roadsides.
